Din roll är att säkerställa att våra kunder kan ta välgrundade affärsbeslut baserade på data.
   

  

**Erfarenhet och kompetens**
 Vi söker dig som gillar att ta stort ansvar, exponeras för olika tekniska och affärsmässiga utmaningar, och som trivs med att jobba från idé till färdig implementering. Vi tror att du har flera års erfarenhet som konsult och är van vid att arbeta med affärsdrivande data och teknik. Du har kanske en bakgrund inom ekonomi, verksamhetsanalys, Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing eller liknande, och du känner dig bekväm med att förstå både siffror och teknikens roll i affärsutveckling. Du är nyfiken på Data Science och generativ AI och hur företag kan använda AI för att bli mer datadrivna. Du är en konsultmässig lagspelare med förmåga att översätta data till konkreta insikter och beslut som skapar affärsnytta för våra kunder. Du trivs i en miljö där du får jobba nära både tekniska lösningar och kundens affär.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har:**
* Flera års erfarenhet av Power BI
* Djup erfarenhet av DAX och Power Query
* Goda teknikkunskaper och förmåga att lösa tekniska problem
* Erfarenhet från bl.a. Azure, Dataverse, Fabric och DevOps
* God förståelse för informations- och datamodellering
* Erfarenhet från andra BI-verktyg (t.ex. Tableau/Qlik/Looker)
* Kunskap om SQL och Python
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Vårt erbjudande**
 B3 Elevate är ett specialistbolag för Power Platform och Dynamics 365 inom B3 Consulting Group med 25+ konsulter och förmåga att leverera digital transformation från strategi, via projekt och till förvaltning. Vi erbjuder stor möjlighet till utveckling och inflytande - både över de lösningar som vi utvecklar samt bolagets riktning. Som Power BI-utvecklare hos oss får du tillgång till ett internt forum där våra BI-konsulter kontinuerligt utbyter erfarenheter och löser frågeställningar tillsammans.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en attraktiv lönemodell, stora utvecklingsmöjligheter och härliga kollegor. Du kommer att ha goda förutsättningar att anpassa dina arbetstider för att uppnå balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Vi ingår i B3 som är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet som är känd för sina operativa och leveranssäkra IT- och management-konsulter. B3 har över 1000 konsulter inom olika expertområden och orter, samt huvudkontor i nya lokaler vid Hötorget.

title: Mobile Developer iOS and Android
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* >4 years' experience working as an iOS/ Android developer
* Very good skills in Swift/ SwiftUI and UIKit
* Very good skills in Kotlin/ Jetpack Compose and XML based UI development
* Used to integrate and work with REST-APIs and JSON
* Experience working with Jira
* Deep understanding of iOS and Android design principles and Code standards
* Very good skills in Kotlin and/or Java, including experience of Rxjava
* Good experience in working with Accessibility.
* Solid experience working in Android Studio and relevant troubleshooting tools


**Meritorious**
* Prior experience working in the retail industry
* Prior experience working with Design System and reusable Design components
* Prior experience working in a larger organization
* Experience working with Scrum, agile ceremonies and/or the SAFe framework


**Application deadline:** 
 12-12-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: SaaS Operations Specialist
description:
In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As we expand our business, we find ourselves in need of a
 ****SaaS Operations Specialist****
 , who will help drive our future journey within the Instabee Tech Ops organization.
   

  

 Reporting to our IT Manager, you will work alongside peers who share the same goal: the continued improvement and efficiency of the TechOps organization. You will facilitate growth and learning, adapting a hands-on approach when necessary, but also knowing when to empower and get out of the way.
   

  

**Some Of The Things You Will Do**
* Help out on a global level by assessing the needs of Instabee and putting effective solutions in place, driving continuous improvement of our platforms.
* Administer, develop, configure, and support IT- and Business applications with a focus on Google Workspace and CRM, amongst other systems.
* Design, implement, and improve automation for Instabee's tech platforms and best practices.
* Provide system administration, configuration, and support on a global level and implement solutions both globally and locally across all Instabee markets.
* Help set up ways-of-working and best practices in close collaboration with the local teams.
* Support and guide our local Instabee teams and assist in cross-team collaboration and communication.
* Proactively identify and work to resolve problems in our fast-paced environment.
* Continue to build on the great culture of dedication, collaboration, and caring for each other, while having fun!


**What We’re Looking For**
 In order to be successful in this role, we believe that you are motivated by solving complex problems and delivering business value efficiently. Your references will highlight your ability to motivate those around you intrinsically, communicate effectively, and always keep the end goal in sight, while looking at the big picture
 *and* 
 zooming in on the details.
   

  

**Skills And Experience**
* At least 4 years of experience working with Google Workspace in an agile and high-paced environment.
* 3+ years of knowledge and experience as a CRM Administrator
* Experience in IT support.
* Experience with advanced UI & workflows.
* Analytical skills and a strong ability to solve problems.
* The ability to provide constructive feedback and collaborate effectively.
* Experience from handling several markets (global or multi-region).
* Experience working in a fast-growing company organization with high levels of ambiguity and flat hierarchy structures.


**The Cherry On Top (Nice-to-haves)**
* Experience in scripting (e.g., Java, Powershell, Google Apps Script).
* You’re great at making others shine and intrinsically motivating others.
* Experience with Slack.
* Knowledge of Mobile Device Management (MDM).
* Experience utilizing Jira Service Management.
* Familiarity with IT security principles and best practices.


***🤝***
**Your Future Team**
 The
 **Tech Ops Team** 
 is part of
 **Foundation** 
 department, acting as the backbone of Instabee’s rapid growth. We are a crucial enabler of efficiency and global expansion, focusing on scaling our internal systems, infrastructure, and technology that keeps the business running.
   

  

 The Foundation department consists of
 **three specialized teams** 
 :
 **IT** 
 (where you will sit),
 **Terminal Tech** 
 , and
 **Hardware R&D** 
 .
   

  

 We are a highly international and impactful team of
 **15 people** 
 (13 in Sweden, 1 in the Netherlands, and 1 in Finland).
   

  

 Our team operates with a
 **high pace** 
 and a strong focus on
 **openness and transparency** 
 . We challenge each other to find the best solutions, and we believe a little fun goes a long way—we are known for being a group that
 **laughs a lot!** 
 This is a place where you will be empowered to own your systems and set the standard for operational excellence.
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills, and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working—this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest!
* ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
* 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts & 👾 Tech Demos: Fuel your midweek with tech talks, tasty bites, and dive into the latest innovations.
* 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us, and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

 If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!

title: Project Manager / Senior Project Manager
description:
**Surgical Science** 
 is a global organization and leading provider of medical training simulations and software solutions.
 



  





 Together with healthcare partners and customers in more than 90 countries, we enhance patient safety and healthcare outcomes through evidence-based, state-of-the-art simulation technology that improves clinical proficiency and performance — enabling safe and effective training without putting patients at risk.
 



  





 Our solutions are used by medical training centers, universities, hospitals, and the medical device industry for practice, assessment, and certification.
 



  





 With offices in Gothenburg, Stockholm, Tel Aviv, Cleveland, Wales, and China, we are a fast-growing and stable organization in a rapidly evolving world. We foster a hybrid work culture that supports onsite and remote collaboration across teams and time zones.
 



  





 Location:
 **Stockholm (Kista) office** 
 preferred, or our
 **Gothenburg** 
 office.
 



 Reporting to
 **Senior Director, Project Management (based in the US).** 




  





**Job summary** 




 We’re looking for a proactive (senior) project manager who thrives in a collaborative environment and can drive delivery across multiple software projects.
 



  




* Lead 3-5 concurrent software development projects for a key customer account with varying scopes, timelines, and budgets
* Drive projects independently from initiation through delivery with distributed development team and customer in a different timezone
* Work as part of the R&D Project Office team and contribute to unified processes, tools, and continuous improvement initiatives
* Manage stakeholder relationships including direct customer communication and cross-functional coordination with engineering, product, and business teams
* Partner with the technical lead to plan and track work, manage risks, and coordinate resources, while the technical lead owns technical decisionsa and team leadership responsibilities
* Own project budgets and cost management for delivery, ensuring financial targets are met
* Establish and maintain project governance including status reporting, risk management, and quality assurance processes



  





**Minimum requirements** 



* **4+ years of software project management experience** 
 with demonstrated progression in complexity and autonomy. Ideally more than 5 years' experience.
* Proven ability to
 **manage 3-5 projects simultaneousl** 
 y with varying timelines, scopes and budgets
* Demonstrated experience
 **leading projects and collaborating with teams and customers across different timezones**
* **Budget management experience** 
 - comfortable working with project financials and delivery costs
* Proven ability to
 **identify project risks and implement mitigation strategie** 
 s proactively
* Track record of
 **independently driving projects** 
 from initiation through delivery with minimal oversight
* **Highly self-motivated and hands-on** 
 - comfortable doing both project planning and day-to-day execution while proactively anticipating team and customer needs
* **Strong facilitation and stakeholder management skills** 
 across technical and non-technical audiences
* **Ability to travel** 
 to customer or team locations on occassion.
* Experience with
 **agile methodologies** 
 (Scrum, Kanban, or similar) in practice, not just theory
* Proficiency with
 **project management tools** 
 (Jira, Monday.com, Office Suite, or equivalent)
* Excellent written and verbal communication in
 **business English**



  





**It is beneficial if you also have any of the following** 



* Program management experience coordinating multiple interconnected projects
* Experience or background in technical project management, simulation technology, medical sciences or gaming
* Experience scaling PM processes or building PMO capabilities in growing organizations
* Power BI or similar reporting/analytics tools
* Technical scripting ability or comfort working closely with developers
* AI workflow automation experience (GPTs, process automation)
* PMP, CSM, or similar certifications



  





**Career path** 



* **Senior PM track:** 
 Progress to Senior Manager Project Management role managing larger, more complex programs and potentially leading other PMs. Develop advanced skills in cross-functional leadership and technical collaboration.
* **PMO leadership:** 
 Shape and scale our project management practices as the organization grows
* **Domain expertise:** 
 Build deep specialization in simulation technology and educational applications with direct customer exposure
* **International exposure:** 
 Opportunity to work with teams and customers across Europe, North America, and Asia - expanding your global project leadership experience
* **Cross-functional growth:** 
 Gain experience across our full product portfolio from concept through commercial deployment



  





**Benefits** 



* 🌍 Global environment (English as primary language)
* 💻 Hybrid work
* ⌚️ Flexible working hours
* ☕ Regular fika
* 🏩 Private healthcare
* 🧘 ♀️ Wellness allowance (Friskvårdsbidrag)
* 🚲 Bike lease



  





**Surgical Science as an employer** 




 Surgical Science is a global and continuously expanding organization. You Will be part of a dynamic, creative environment where we make sure to make room for all employees to influence and contribute with their own unique experiences and knowledge.
 



 Guided by our core values —
 **curiosity, respect,** 
 and
 **perseverance** 
 — we strive to empower our people by recognizing their strengths, supporting their growth, and creating opportunities to make a real impact.
 



 We invite you to join us on this exciting and meaningful journey — to shape the future of medical training and improve care for patients around the world.
 



  





**Apply today!** 




 If you think you would fit our awesome team and enjoy our work environment, apply as soon as possible as recruitment is ongoing. Let us meet and figure out together whether we are a match! We kindly request that you apply with a
 **resume in English.**

title: Sales Executive
description:
At Buddywise, our mission is to create safer workplaces using technology. We are an innovative AI company driven by a clear "Zero Injury Vision", ensuring that every employee returns home safely.
   

  

 The Buddywise platform uses computer vision to automate the detection of workplace safety risks and enables users to become data-driven in their safety management. Our customers are some of the world's top tier industrial companies, that are committed to all of their employees returning home safely.
   

  

**Your Role**
 We are not looking for just another salesperson. We're looking for a sales professional with a proven track record and a true entrepreneurial spirit who has
 *built* 
 a sales motion before and is excited to do it again - this time for a mission that matters.
   

  

 This is your chance to move beyond a simple quota and apply your hard-won skills to co-create a best-in-class sales motion from the ground up.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
* Building the Foundation: Driving the development of our sales stack and toolkit to ensure our GTM strategy is efficient and scalable
* Owning the Full Cycle: Building a robust sales pipeline, winning new customers, and managing the entire sales process from initial prospecting to closing 'POCs' (Proof of Concepts)
* Driving Expansion: Leading the commercial process for expansion opportunities within existing customers after their 'POC' is successful
* Evolving the Playbook:Taking our existing sales 'playbook' and assuming responsibility for constantly improving and evolving it as our sales process and customer base mature
* Acting as a Strategic Partner: Collaborating extensively across the business, especially with Customer Success and Product teams, and analyzing market trends to identify new opportunities


**Qualifications And Experience**
* A Proven Track Record: 5+ years in new business B2B sales, consistently hitting and exceeding targets, ideally in a fast-paced startup environment
* Enterprise Sales Mastery: Deep experience in 'Enterprise' sales, managing high ACV propositions sold into complex, multi-stakeholder customers
* A Builder's Mindset: You're a strategic thinker who can follow a structured sales process (experience with MEDDIC or SPIN is a plus) but also know when to be creative
* A "Hands-On" Approach: You lead by example, love solving hard problems, and are obsessed with understanding customer pains
* A Tech-Forward Approach: You are analytical and comfortable using modern sales tools, including AI-native tools, to drive automation and sales velocity


**What We Offer**
* A competitive salary and commission structure
* Meaningful ownership through our competitive Share Options program
* A hybrid work setup offering flexibility
* True autonomy and significant room for personal growth as the company grows
* The opportunity to be a driving force in shaping the future of AI and industrial safety


**Our Company Culture**
 We are:
   

  

* Obsessed with creating amazing software for our Customers that solves real pains and realises tangible value
* Positive by Default and thrive in doing hard things and solving problems
* Biased for Action and approach what we do with a sense of urgency
* Love to work as a team and Win Together, each contributing skill, fun and care
* Can balance Thinking Holistically whilst Executing in the Details


 Join us and be a part of reshaping industrial safety with Buddywise! 🚀
   

  

***Don't meet every single requirement?***
*Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply for*
*jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Buddywise, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.*

title: Juniora verksamhetsutvecklare till CIO Office i Stockholm
description:
Placeringsort Flera orterDiarienummer FK 2025/028100
   

  

 Logga in och sök jobbet Öppnas i nytt fönster
   

  

*Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan 21 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 260 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför tänker vi nytt och använder den senaste tekniken för att förenkla och förbättra, utveckla och leverera it-tjänsterna för den svenska socialförsäkringen. Välkommen till en av Sveriges största IT-avdelningar.*
 Beslut och utbetalningar sker digitalt och därför är IT-avdelningens uppdrag inom Försäkringskassan helt avgörande. IT-avdelningen består av ca 1400 medarbetare och flera hundra konsulter på åtta it-kontor i Sverige. För att leda IT-avdelningen finns ett CIO Office där verksamhets- och ekonomistyrning, juridisk IT-kompetens samt kansliet för samordnad säker statlig IT-drift samlas.
   

  

 Verksamhetsförflyttningar, presentationer och workshops
   

  

 Som verksamhetsutvecklare inom CIO Office bidrar du till organisationens olika uppdrag. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med många olika parter i verksamheten. Det finns stort utrymme för egna initiativ till förbättring. Du kommer ha del i IT-avdelningens kommunikation med omvärlden, med fokus på kommunikativ paketering av interna budskap, rapporter, utredningar och underlag till ledningen. Du bör därför vara pedagogisk, se mönster, kunna visualisera komplexa sammanhang, tycka om att kommunicera och behärska det svenska språket mycket väl.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer i hög grad handla om att tillsammans med andra utveckla samhället, genom att i samspel med vår IT-avdelning, övriga delar av Försäkringskassan samt övriga Myndighetssverige bidra till förenkling och förflyttning mot uppsatta mål.
   

  

 Dina uppdrag kommer spänna mellan att effektivisera IT-verksamheten till att bidra i remissvar till Regeringskansliet. I denna roll kommer du samla information, analysera, sammanställa och rekommendera inför beslut, liksom att införa, följa upp, justera och bidra till organisatoriskt lärande. Du kommer få bra insikt i hur man bedriver en effektiv IT-verksamhet, men också hur samspelet mellan myndighet och politiken fungerar. Du behöver vara övertygande, uthållig och prestigelös för att nå resultat och ha förmåga att välja rätt arbetssätt för att framgångsrikt leda utan att vara chef.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.
   

  

 Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* är civilingenjör, eller erfarenheter och kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga
* har ett systematiskt och effektivt arbetssätt
* samarbetar effektivt med andra för att nå gemensamma mål
* identifierar problem snabbt och löser dessa på ett relevant sätt
* har god kommunikativ förmåga, i både tal och skrift
* agerar på eget initiativ och tar ansvar för att nå goda resultat
* är trygg och förtroendeingivande, även i belastade situationer.


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* har erfarenhet av att arbeta i stora organisationer
* har erfarenhet av att leda andra utan att vara chef.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 Tre tjänster, tillsvidare, heltid, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kommer tillämpas. I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering. För den här tjänsten krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Möjlighet till distansarbete finns om arbetet tillåter. I den här rekryteringen kommer arbetspsykologiska test användas som en del i urvalsarbetet.
   

  

 Placeringsorter: [Stockholm eller Sundsvall.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassan som arbetsgivare? Besök fk.se/jobbahososs
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Chef: Julia Brundin 010-114 07 34 eller Juha Alskog 010-112 95 92 (för frågor om tjänsten). HR-specialist: Klas Lindblad, klas.lindblad@fk.se, 010-113 10 43 (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen). Fackliga representanter är för ST Peter Lampinen, Saco-S Ann Wiström, Seko Eliza Grundström. Dessa nås via vår växel 08-786 90 00.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 6 januari 2026. Ladda gärna upp dina examensbevis, betyg och intyg i samband med din ansökan.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter eller ingen tillgång till bank-id ringer du den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi ska i allt vi gör, agera med utgångspunkt i principen om alla människors lika värde, rättssäkerhet och med god service.

title: Software Engineer, Storage
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 As a Software Engineer on the evroc Storage team, you will help lay the foundations of highly performant and scalable cloud storage solutions operating at mission-critical levels of availability and durability. You will be involved in all phases of the product lifecycle including design, architecture, development, deployment and maintenance.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Design, develop and maintain evroc’s cloud storage offerings including S3 object storage, block storage and shared file systems.
* Build components using first principles from the ground up to unlock optimization opportunities at every layer of the stack.
* Optimize existing cloud storage solutions for performance ensuring low latency and high throughput, high reliability and cost effectiveness.
* Work with appropriate stakeholders to determine user requirements. Leverage a variety of feedback channels to incorporate insights into future designs or solution fixes.
* Seamlessly integrate and upkeep open-source components within our evolving tech stack. Team up with fellow engineers to craft tailored solutions meeting our unique challenges.
* Lead the charge in defining and achieving our technical benchmarks.


**Skills We Value**
* Proficiency in distributed systems and Linux systems engineering.
* Coding in programming languages such as C, C++, Golang or Rust.
* Typically 5+ years of experience in building and enhancing clustered storage solutions such as Ceph, Gluster, HDFS, Lustre or MinIO or cloud storage such as AWS S3, EBS, GCP’s Blob/Block/File Storage.
* Extensive experience within the Kubernetes ecosystem developing and running highly available services. Helm, Kustomize, Knative, Rook and controller runtime knowledge is a plus.
* Deep understanding of databases, file systems and storage protocols. (Bonus) experience in Solid-State Drive (SSD)/NAND or Hard Disk Drive (HDD) based storage technologies, interfaces (e.g., NVMe, SATA/SAS), and security standards (TCG).
* Knowledge of performance tuning and optimization techniques.
* Active engagement or contributions to the open-source community.
* Collaborative, curious, and pragmatic Software Engineer who wants to be part of an innovative team.


 Please note you do not need to have experience with all of the technologies listed above to apply. If your background is in storage technologies and distributed systems, and you are passionate about building a better cloud, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Data Scientist (Knowledge Graph)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With over 550 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Knowledge graph consultant, you will help our clients make better data-driven decisions by modeling and building robust data flows, creating an efficient data transporter, and building data architecture for Machine Learning solutions and BI solutions. You will also work with the development of computer science solutions stars on graph technology.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Assisting our clients in their work, as they exploit the capabilities of the W3C Semantic Stack (RDF, RDFS, SPARQL, OWL, SHACL), graph databases and ontology modelling tools, or tech stack like Neo4j, Cypher or Labeled Property Graph implementations.
* Combining knowledge graphs with Natural Language Processing – a perfect opportunity for someone with a background as linguist combined with a great interest in knowledge graphs.
* Working with a variation of clients located across Northern Europe. In a hybrid working model, you might be asked to travel while on other occasions you will be working remotely.
* Bringing success in the role, by thriving in an international environment, where you generously share your domain knowledge within Graph technology.


**Your profile**
* You have worked in the public or private sector, where you have used your domain experience in knowledge graph technologies. You enjoy solving complex modeling problems
* Knowledge about Linked Data Concepts
* ETL processes with various graph databases and experience in Interaction with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages
* Information and Data Management
* Programming skills (specific language is not required, but we use Python, Java or .Net)
* Semantic technologies: Utilize (W3C) Standards of the Semantic Stack. Knowledge regarding several databases (or excellent on at least one) and modelling knowledge with ontologies using various tools.
* Skills for LPG: Knowledge regarding several databases or excellent on at least one.
* You live in Stockholm Greater area of Sweden.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We work closely with Neo4J on both a local and European level.


**Application**
 Welcome to apply!
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Make it real |** 
**www.capgemini.com**

title: Platform Engineer GCP
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som molntekniker, eller motsvarande inom molnplattformen GCP.
* Minst 1 tidigare uppdrag från att ha arbetat i en produktionsmiljö med molnplattformen GCP.
* Relevant akademisk utbildning eller annan dokumenterad kunskap inhämtad genom utbildningar, certifieringar eller erfarenhet.
* Minst 1 tidigare uppdrag inom cloudmigrering, alternativ nyuppsättning av en cloudmiljö såsom landingzone mm.
* God förmåga att uttrycka sig på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Minst 1 tidigare uppdrag från att ha arbetat med GKE


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet och kunskap inom IaC och gärna cloud build.
* Erfarenhet och kunskap inom crossplane.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Kubernetes
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Envoy
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med EntraId
* Minst 1 uppdrag sedan innan där man har jobbat med PKI (Public Key Infrastructure)
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med moderna säkerhetsprinciper som Zero Trust, Least Privelege och DevSecOps.
* Erfarenhet av mer än ett (1) tidigare uppdrag av att ha arbetat med komplexa och transaktionsintensiva IT-miljöer mot B2C (som exempelvis inom detaljhandel, bank eller finans), med höga krav på tillgänglighet, konfidentialitet, riktighet, spårbarhet och tillgänglighet.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 06-01-2026
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Seniora it-drifttekniker, klientplattform
description:
Enheten för it-drift, it-infrastruktur och it-säkerhet söker ett flertal seniora it-drifttekniker som ska delta i det dagliga arbetet med drift och förvaltning av Åklagarmyndighetens it-miljö. Som senior it-drifttekniker ingår du i enheten för it-drift, it-infrastruktur och it-säkerhet som består av 50 medarbetare inom olika teknikområden.
   

  

**Enheten Ansvarar För**
* Löpande drift och förvaltning av myndighetens it-infrastruktur, system och tekniska plattformar
* Bemanning av beredskapen dygnet runt året runt samt andra och tredje linjen inom vår it-organisation.


 Dina arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Arbetet på enheten innebär möjlighet att jobba med moderna system och verktyg i en it-miljö med stor vikt på it-drift- och it-säkerhet.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden kommer främst att vara drift, förvaltning av Åklagarmyndighetens it-infrastruktur och tekniska plattformar, Vilket innefattar underhåll, installation och konfiguration samt avancerad felsökning och åtgärder av myndighetens it-infrastruktur, tekniska plattformar och relaterade stödsystem. Säkerhetstänket är väl utvecklat och är en naturlig del i arbetet.
   

  

 Du kommer även att arbeta med daglig drift, incidenthantering, övervakningslarm, underhålla och säkerställa drift och tillgänglighet och vara en naturlig del i supportkedjan som spänner över samtliga teknikområden, samt att delta i olika projekt. Du är en centralt placerad resurs med bra överblick över samtliga system och komponenter för att upptäcka förbättringsåtgärder.
   

  

 Dina kvaliteter och kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* gymnasieexamen eller motsvarande utbildning inom it som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant
* flera års väl vitsordad arbetslivserfarenhet inom it-infrastrukturområdet
* ett stort tekniskt intresse och förståelse för grundläggande it-teknik
* viljan och förmåga att lära dig nya generationer av nuvarande teknisk plattform.


 Du har spetskompetens inom några av följande områden:
   

  

* Automatisering med Script (PowerShell)
* Virtualisering (VMware, Nutanix, Containers, Podman, Kubernetes)
* Operativsystem Server (Windows server 2022 och versionshantering)
* Autentisering (Kerberos, SAMLv2, OpenID-Connect)
* Active Directory
* Exchange, spam och antiviruslösningar (Fortimail, fortisandbox)
* Certifikatslösningar, Kryptering och signering (PKI)
* Databashantering (MS SQL)


 Som person vill vi att du
   

  

* är ansvarstagande och har en god samarbetsförmåga
* är lyhörd och relaterar till din omgivning på ett smidigt sätt med din positiva attityd och inställning
* är strukturerad, ordningsam och säkerställer kvalitet i ditt arbetsresultat
* är lösningsorienterad och prestigelös
* har lätt för att uttrycka dig i tal och i skrift både på svenska och engelska.


 Det är meriterande om du har kunskap och erfarenhet av
   

  

* teknisk projektledning
* it-drift i organisationer med höga säkerhetskrav.


 Om anställningen
   

  

 Vi är en modern arbetsplats som möjliggör distansarbete, vilket gör att många medarbetare på it-avdelningen både arbetar på kontoret och virtuellt.
   

  

 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning med 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Tester förekommer i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och därmed sker säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.
   

  

 På grund av arkivbestämmelser sparar vi ansökningar i två år. När du ansöker kommer dina personuppgifter att behandlas enligt offentlighetsprincipen samt dataskyddsförordningen. När du skickar din ansökan till oss, samtycker du till detta.
   

  

 Åklagarmyndigheten som arbetsgivare
   

  

 På Åklagarmyndigheten känner vi stolthet när vi går till jobbet. Tillsammans är vi 2 200 engagerade och kompetenta medarbetare som står upp för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och demokratiska värden. Oavsett roll i myndigheten så bidrar alla till vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag.
   

  

 Vill du bli en del av Åklagarmyndigheten? Vi strävar efter att vara en välkomnande och inkluderande arbetsplats som speglar samhällets mångfald.
   

  

 Ansök redan i dag!

title: Python Code Reviewer for LLM Data Training
description:
**Weekly Hours:** 
 17-20 hours per week
 



**Assignment Duration:** 
 Approximately 2 to 3 weeks
 



**Timing:** 
 You have the flexibility to work at any time.
 



  





**Project Description** 




 This project involves reviewing AI-generated responses, evaluating technical accuracy and best practices, and providing expert feedback that trains AI systems to write better code. You'll work with various programming languages and coding challenges, ensuring AI outputs are functional, efficient, and follow industry standards.
 



  





**About Company** 




 We provide a platform that bridges subject-matter experts with AI projects, enabling them to contribute their knowledge to improve AI models. It offers flexible opportunities to work on tasks like data labeling, quality assurance, and domain-specific problem-solving while earning competitive pay.
 



  





**Hiring Profile** 



* BS, MS, or PhD with significant focus on Computer Science (Required).
* Expert in Python, with a strong grasp of algorithms, data structures, and debugging practices.
* Expert-level English proficiency with excellent writing skills.
* Expert at fact-checking information using public sources across multiple domains.
* Significant experience using large language models (LLMs).
* Strong analytical and structured thinking skills.
* Ability to explain complex programming concepts clearly and accurately.



  





**Preferred** 



* Prior experience with RLHF annotation.
* Prior Software Engineering work experience.
* Expertise in additional programming languages (nice to have): C#, Java, SQL, C++, TypeScript, PHP, C, Go, Bash, PowerShell, Rust, R.



  





**Application & Onboarding Process** 



* **Qualification exam (1–2 hours):** 
 evaluates your role-specific expertise. Compensation is provided upon passing.
* **Project exam (1–2 hours):** 
 evaluates your adherence to project guidelines and ability to produce
 **Python-specific** 
 deliverables. Compensation is provided upon passing.



  





**Commitment** 



* We expect a minimum of 17-20 hours per week; however, considering the project scope and timelines the preferred and recommended commitment would be 8 hours/day.

title: Partner Director
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm or London
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 We’re looking for a strategic Partner Director to build and scale one of evroc’s most important partnerships in Europe. Reporting to the Vice President of Partnerships & Alliances, you will define the partnership vision, establish a joint sales and marketing motion, and shape initiatives that address sovereignty challenges across governments, critical infrastructure sectors, and enterprise customers.
   

  

 In this role, you will collaborate closely with partner executives, evroc leadership, product and engineering teams to co-create new solutions, drive adoption of evroc’s sovereign cloud, and unlock ecosystem opportunities that amplify long-term impact. This is a rare opportunity to influence Europe’s cloud landscape at a foundational level.
   

  

**What You’ll Tackle**
* Define and execute the strategic partnership plan, ensuring alignment with evroc leadership and partner executives.
* Build and lead a dedicated partnership sales and marketing motion across European markets.
* Drive joint pipeline generation, co-selling, business development and co-marketing initiatives.
* Work with product and engineering teams to co-develop offerings, integrations and services that meet sovereignty and compliance needs.
* Lead strategic joint programmes that address sovereignty requirements across public and private-sector industries.
* Structure partnership agreements, incentive models and joint business plans; set long-term growth targets.
* Recruit, mentor and grow a high-performing partnership team; serve as the internal advocate for the partnership.
* Represent evroc and the partnership ecosystem at industry events and contribute to Europe’s sovereignty dialogue.


**Skills We Value**
* 10+ years of experience building and scaling technology partnerships or channel programmes in cloud, SaaS or related industries.
* Proven ability to shape partnership strategy and turn it into measurable growth and market impact.
* Strong relationship leadership skills with the ability to influence C-suite stakeholders.
* Experience negotiating complex partnership agreements and leading high-performing teams.
* Solid understanding of cloud technologies, integrations and technical ecosystems.
* Excellent communication and cross-functional collaboration skills.


**Why Join evroc?**
 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Operation Engineer - Active Directory
description:
Vi på Vattenfall IT söker nu Operation Engineer inom Active Directory som vill arbeta med utveckling och leverans av IT-tjänster, där säker och stabil drift står högt på agendan. För dig som kandidat är det här en chans att ta plats i en organisation som genomgår en spännande förvandling med ny teknik och utökade samarbetsytor, där vi värdesätter trivsel på arbetsplatsen tillsammans med en öppen och ärlig atmosfär.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer bestå av daglig drift, övervakning och larmhantering av infrastrukturplattformar samt att driva utveckling i inom ditt område. Som Operation Engineer kommer du att ha ett omväxlande arbete med breda ansvarsområden i en leverans som ombesörjer allt från tjänster kopplat till autentisering och behörigheter, 3rd line support och domännamnsystem (DNS).
   

  

 Som Operation Engineer
 
 kommer du att vara en del av ett team men vi ser även att du har förmågan att arbeta självständigt mot externa leverantörer såväl som kollegor runt om i Sverige och Europa. För dig som individ finns det stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och påverkan i den dagliga leveransen.
   

  

**Dina Dagliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Ansvara för drift av autentisering och behörigheter inom Active Directory
* Public key infrastruktur
* Effektivisera och automatisera arbetssätt och system
* Övervakning och larmhantering av infrastrukturplattformar
* Patchning och systemuppdateringar
* 3rd line felsökning för ärenden inom infrastruktur
* Arbeta i projekt för nya tekniska lösningar
* Livscykel-hantering och planering av IT infrastruktur


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Är Framåtriktad Och Lösningsorienterad. Vi Ser Gärna Också Att Du Som Söker Är Förtroendeskapande, Både Inom Den Egna Gruppen Och Mot Övrig Verksamhet. Du Trivs i Förändring Och Har En Naturlig Strävan Mot Ständiga Förbättringar. Du Har God Samarbetsförmåga Och Ett Ödmjukt Förhållningssätt Till Människor Omkring Dig. Du Trivs Att Samarbeta Med Andra Och Har Även God Struktur i Ditt Egna Arbete. Vi Tror Att Du Har Dessa Kompetenser/erfarenheter
   

  

* Bred förståelse av IT och att drift av datacenters
* Brinner för felsökning i varierad storlek och komplexitet
* Förstår och anammar högt IT säkerhetstänk
* Är en naturlig lagspelare och förstår vikten av samarbete och dela med sig av erfarenheter aktivt
* Driven, tar egna initiativ och är självgående
* Har ett strukturerat och metodiskt arbetssätt
* Har ett genuint intresse av att lära sig och förstå ny teknik
* Är flytande i både svenska och engelska, både tal och skrift


 Det är
 **meriterande** 
 om du har större kompetens eller certifiering inom ett eller flera områden, t.ex.;
   

  

* Har erfarenhet av Active Directory Services
* Har erfarenhet av PKI/HSM
* Har erfarenhet av ADFS
* Har erfarenhet av Exchange
* Kunskaper om IT-relaterade processer och ramverk såsom ITIL


 Ytterligare information
   

  

*Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.*
**Placeringsort**
 Forsmark, Ringhals, Stockholm (Solna)
   

  

**För mer information** 
 om själva tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Emma Bosch, 070-4934466. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Julia Norberg, julia.norberg@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Fackliga representanter via Vattenfalls växel, 08 739 50 00. Sofi Wadström (Akademikerna), Patricia Ek (Unionen), Christer Gustafsson (Ledarna), Juha Siipilehto (SEKO)
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-12-14.** 
 Urval och intervjuer sker efter sista ansökningsdatum. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i ansökan. Du söker snabbt och enkelt genom att svara på urvalsfrågor och bifoga ditt CV.
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.
   

  

 Då säkerheten för Vattenfall och dess anställda är avgörande kommer vi innan varje anställning genomföra en ”pre-employment screening”. Dessa kontroller baseras på din roll som du kommer att fylla inom Vattenfall.
   

  

 Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Företagsbeskrivning
   

  

 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid.

title: Senior data scientist
description:
**Rollen:**
**Ska-krav:**
* Implementera AI och maskininlärning för att öka träffsäkerhet samt effektivisera insiktsgenerering.
* 
* Applicera analyser inom områden som trendspaningar, prognoser och tidsserieanalyser.
* 
* Koppla samman flera datakällor, både interna och externa, för att skapa kärnfulla analyser.
* 
* Vidareutveckla automatiserade arbetsflöden och säkra att datalager (Azure storage) och IT-förutsättningar stödjer analysarbetet.
* 
* Leda och coacha teamet kring AI-möjligheter och hitta relevanta tillämpningsområden.
* 
* Delta i tvärfunktionella arbetsgrupper för att dela best practice och skapa synergier med andra delar av företaget.
* 
* Säkerställa affärsvärde i analyserna genom förståelse för både teknik och affär.
* 
* Utveckla teknik från MVP till produktionssättning.
* 
* Presentera analyser och insikter internt på ett tydligt sätt, anpassat till olika målgrupper inom verksamheten.
* Flertal års erfarenhet av programmering i Python, PySpark eller liknande programmeringsspråk
* 
* Flertal års erfarenhet av att bygga effektiv och tydlig kod för att realisera AI-initiativ från MVP till värdeinhämtning
* 
* Flertal års erfarenhet av att analysera stora datamängder genom maskininlärning
* 
* Erfarenhet av GenAI för marknads- och trendspaningar
* 
* Erfarenhet av prediktiv modellering och prognoser
* 
* Relevant akademisk examen


**Meriterande:**
**Var god förklara hur du uppfyller alla kraven.
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete med datakvalitet; identifiera och adressera brister samt initiera förbättringsinitiativ
* 
* Erfarenhet av visualiseringsprogram som Power BI


 Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Ort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Period** 
 : 11-01-2026-30-09-2026
   

  

**Sista ansökningdag:** 
 16-12-2025
   

  

*Vi presenterar löpande. Om du är intresserad av ett uppdrag rekommenderar vi att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.*

title: Software Sales Specialist
description:
Join our team as a Software Sales Executive for our DELMIA Brand and help our clients to reach their full potential. This opportunity can be based in our Gothenburg or Stockholm office.
   

  

 Dassault Systèmes, the 3DEXPERIENCE company provides businesses and people with virtual universes to imagine sustainable innovations. Our world-leading solutions transform the way products are designed, produced and supported. At Dassault Systèmes we empower people with passion for change and innovation. WeAre3DS
   

  

 DELMIA, powered by the 3DEXPERIENCE platform, helps industries and service providers connect the virtual and real world of value networks to collaborate, model, simulate, optimize and perform. Operational excellence requires harmony across the value network. DELMIA provides solutions to leverage the virtual world of modelling, simulation and optimization with the real world of operations to provide a complete solution to value network stakeholders. From suppliers to producers, to logistics and transportation providers, to service operators and workforces.
   

  

 Role & Responsibilities
   

  

* Lead Customer Executive relationships and global ecosystem to support enterprise and business transformation
* Work with clients in the industries; Transport & Mobility, Industrial Equipment, High Tech, Life Sciences, Aerospace & Defense and Marine & Offshore
* Become part of a team, whose passion is to help our customers reach their visions and at the same time grow and expand our business across your assigned territory within the EuroNorth region (UK, Ireland, Benelux, Nordics and/or Baltics)
* Build and develop trusted relationships at executive level and within all layers of the client organization
* Meet objectives against plan by addressing the customers challenges and drive value agreements
* Maintain accurate account plans and forecast
* Act as the voice of the customer within Dassault Systèmes


**Qualifications/Experience**
* Proven successful software solution sales (any of the following: IBP, S&OP, APS, MES, MOM, Manufacturing Engineering etc)
* Good communication and negotiation skills, fluent Swedish and language skills are required
* Manufacturing Industry knowledge
* Ability to understand our software and optimization for Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain, how the customer can gain value
* Ability to manage end to end customer engagements


 What’s in it for you
   

  

* An international and diverse working environment in a collaborative team
* Flexible working hours with hybrid working model, a good work-life balance and comprehensive benefits package
* Extensive skills and career development programs to build your journey with us


 Interested? Click on "Apply" to upload your application documents.
   

  

 Inclusion statement
   

  

 As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

title: Storage Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Do you want to work with cutting-edge Nvidia and AI technology?
   

  

 Great, we are strengthening our team to architect and operate AI supercomputers securing Ericsson’s AI leadership.
   

  

 These new supercomputers are extremely fast and draw huge amounts of power, testing the limits of power distribution, liquid cooling, network & storage capacity
   

  

 Join us and shape Ericsson in the age of AI.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Be responsible for managing the storage solutions in our datacentres including storage administration, software and hardware maintenance, disaster recovery and security.
* Manage and optimize the storage environment as well as support complex changes and new implementations.
* Design, operate and monitor storage platforms
* Support in design of new services and platforms
* Act as driver and technical coordinator for demands, projects and tasks
* Contribute to technical innovations
* Lead the work and participate in hardware and software installation of new, remove, repair, upgrade, and patching.
* Act as contact person towards stakeholders and collaborating with other departments to ensure that IT operations are aligned with organizational goals and objectives.
* Work with storage IT infrastructure systems supporting the NVIDIA SuperPOD


**The skills you bring:**
* Proven experience working as a Storage Engineer
* Driven by technical and operational challenges and have a desire to enable your team to improve and deliver efficient, stable, compliant, and secure services.
* Ability to plan your own work and enjoy communicating and working closely with stakeholders and team members
* Team-spirit mentality to reach common goals together with your team.
* Experience as File/S3/Backup/Hybrid-cloud Storage engineer, Storage Devops Engineer and Storage Architect or equivalent level of knowledge.
* Experience in managing and troubleshooting storage
* Knowledge of storage systems, management software, tools and AI technology and methodology
* Relevant competence in NW and server infrastructure
* Experience of working with AI infrastructure and end to end workflows (NVIDIA) management software and tools
* Understanding and experience of automation and programming languages such as Ansible, Phyton, APIs and Kubernetes.
* Fluency in English, both written and verbal.


 A safety interview may be required for final candidates in this process.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Linköping
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 773123

title: Senior QA Engineer
description:
Are you a dynamic and experienced Senior Quality Assurance Engineer ready to make a meaningful impact on product quality? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! Join our collaborative Development Team at ASSA ABLOY Digital and Access Solutions, EMEIA, based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 We are a team of curious, creative, and skilled developers, testers, and architects, dedicated to building the next generation of embedded products. We work together in a supportive and open environment—where promises are kept, challenges are addressed proactively, and asking for help is encouraged. We value collaboration, continuous learning, and enjoy sharing laughter even after work.
   

  

**What you would do as our Senior Quality Assurance Engineer**
 You would join a team of skilled developers and QA engineers working on APERIO, a leading wireless access control technology by ASSA ABLOY that enables secure, real-time electronic locking without complex wiring.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Collaborate with global stakeholders who integrate our technology into various products, contributing to our mission of helping people feel safe, secure, and experience a more open world.
* Participate in the entire testing lifecycle, including test planning, analysis, design, implementation, execution (system testing), and completion.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of testing processes and tools to ensure high-quality product delivery.
* Work in a cross-functional environment, supporting both development and quality assurance efforts across embedded systems.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in embedded Quality Assurance and Quality Control.
* Strong programming skills, especially in Python, Robot Framework, and GitLab; experience with LabView, C/C++, Zephyr, Linux, SQL, or ODBC is a plus.
* Hands-on knowledge of container technologies, such as Docker.
* Understanding of IP communication protocols, including DNS, DHCP, and TLS.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and test automation, plus a relevant B.Sc. degree and fluency in English.


 Ideally, you would also have experience in system testing and HIL creation, along with a background in agile development, preferably using Scrum. Familiarity with low-power, battery-operated products and wireless technologies such as BLE and Zigbee is valuable. Experience with automated testing and RFID credential technologies like Seos, MIFARE DESFire, ISO14443, and UWB is a plus. Knowledge of mobile access control and an understanding of current standards and trends in IoT connectivity and cybersecurity are also highly beneficial.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a successful career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, please email Alexandra Kymäläinen, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at alexandra.kymalainen@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be subject to background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com .
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Website Engineer - Nuxt / Vue
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid)
   

  

 The Opportunity
   

  

 We are looking for a Website Engineer to take ownership of the public face of our products.
   

  

 Until now, this responsibility has been spread across multiple engineers in our team. As we continue to grow, we realized we need a dedicated expert to take full ownership of this scope.
   

  

 You will tackle two distinct challenges:
 **building a whole new site** 
 from the ground up for
 **Solo** 
 (our upcoming SaaS brand) and
 **maintaining, updating, and upgrading** 
**Portail Auto-Entrepreneur.fr** 
 (our flagship platform). Together, these platforms welcome
 **over 700,000 unique visitors every year** 
 .
   

  

**Your goal is to create the most attractive public sites for our services.**
 We want platforms that look good and perform. You will develop sites that rank highly in search engines, captivate visitors with a premium feel, and convert traffic into happy users. You will act as the bridge between creative vision, content strategy, and technical execution.
   

  

**About Betao**
 We are the leading company serving
 **sole entrepreneurs in France** 
 , with 70+ collaborators proudly based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**We Empower Small Business Owners Through Two Main Offerings**
* Administrative Services: We help customers create, modify, or close their companies. We have created hundreds of thousands of companies in France over the years, removing the headache of French bureaucracy.
* Invoicing SaaS: Our software helps these entrepreneurs manage their business daily, handling everything from quotes to payments.


 We offer a unique mix. We have the stability and scale of a market leader in France, combined with the work-life balance of a Swedish tech company. We are profitable, "default alive," and building for the long term.
   

  

 The Stack & Skills
   

  

 We insist on modern, high-quality tooling. You’ll fit right in if you are comfortable with:
   

  

* Core Frameworks & Architecture: You are an expert in Nuxt (Vue.js) and Tailwind. You care deeply about writing clean, reusable code and maintaining shared libraries across our different websites. We use shadcn-vue for our component library, and we expect you to know how to leverage it to ship faster without reinventing the wheel. You have experience deploying websites using modern frontend Cloud platforms (like Vercel, Netlify, or Cloudflare Pages).
* Analytics & Data: We are users of PostHog and Google Tag Manager. You understand how to implement tracking correctly, how to analyze funnel performance, and how to use data to spot friction points in the user journey. You are comfortable setting up A/B tests and feature flags to experiment and validate what converts best.
* Headless CMS: We use Storyblok. You will architect headless content models that are scalable and flexible. You care about the editor experience: building a setup where our marketing team can publish fast and build pages independently without needing to ping you for every change.
* Design Collaboration: You appreciate a well-structured Figma. You understand the power of design tokens and component architecture. You rely on variables to maintain consistency across the entire platform.
* Performance & SEO: You understand that a fast website is a successful website. You care deeply about Core Web Vitals, PageSpeed scores, and maintaining a solid technical SEO structure.
* Project Ownership: You won't have a dedicated project manager to organize your day. You own your backlog, manage your priorities, and provide total transparency on your progress to the rest of the team
* Architectural Mindset: You don't just blindly build what is asked. You step back to understand the business goal and how the request fits into the global site architecture. You advise our teams on the best technical approach to achieve their vision, ensuring we build sustainable and flexible solutions rather than quick hacks.


 How we work
   

  

**Collaboration is key**
 You are a core member of the
 **Tech Team** 
 , but you will work daily with our Marketing, Product, SEO, SEA/Ads, Content, and Design teams.
   

  

* SEO: You work hand-in-hand with our SEO Manager to turn strategy into code. You handle the technical implementation of their recommendations, ranging from schema markup and sitemaps to solving complex crawl or indexing issues.
* Content & Design: You help them present complex information beautifully. You ensure our landing pages, articles, and guides look as good as they read, on all devices.
* SEA & Growth: You handle rapid landing page iterations, implement ad tracking, and constantly optimize conversion funnels based on real data.
* You: The technical execution and the "how."


 We rely on you to advise on feasibility and ensure our tracking is robust so we never fly blind.
   

  

**Autonomy & Ownership**
 We trust you to make decisions. We expect you to take full ownership of the websites. If you spot a way to improve our lighthouse score, streamline a user journey, or refactor a component for better reusability, you have the freedom to make it happen.
   

  

 Why join?
   

  

* Impact: Your work is the first thing 700k+ entrepreneurs see when they start their journey with us.
* Growth: We are launching new ventures (like Solo) and you’ll be on the ground floor of that growth.
* Culture: We are transparent, friendly, and truly multicultural (yes, lots of French people!) but deeply anchored in Sweden. You will work alongside other talented developers who care about their craft.
* Flexible Hybrid Model: We are based in Stockholm and we love our office, but we respect your focus time. We operate a flexible hybrid policy: come in to sync up, grab a coffee, and see real human faces, but feel free to work from home when you need deep focus.


**Ready to help build the faces of Betao?**
 Apply below. We’d love to see what you’ve created.

title: Office Coordinator
description:
**Department:** 
 Core - Business Infrastructure & Operations
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  




**Description**
 We are seeking an organised, proactive and detail-oriented Office Coordinator for our Stockholm office. As the sole operations professional on-site, you will be responsible for ensuring the smooth day-to-day running of the office, by managing facilities, coordinating suppliers, and providing essential administrative support. Working closely with regional and central teams, you will play a key role in maintaining an efficient and well-functioning workplace.
   

  

 This role is highly visible and critical to our Stockholm team. The ideal candidate is reliable, adaptable, and confident in managing multiple responsibilities independently. The successful candidate will be expected to work on-site a minimum of four days per week. One day per week may be worked remotely, subject to operational needs.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Responsible for the day-to-day running of the local office, including ordering office & kitchen supplies, handling all office correspondence, processing supplier invoices and welcoming visitors
* Build and manage relationships with suppliers and service providers, negotiating contracts and ensuring high-quality service delivery
* Manage all facility-related needs, proactively identifying and resolving maintenance issues, including coordinating with third-party service providers
* Support the BIO leadership team in budgeting and financial reporting for office operations, procurement, and local activities
* Act as the central point of contact for all office operations, collaborating with key departments such as People & Culture, Finance, and IT to support office needs
* Provide administrative support as needed, including scheduling meetings, booking travel, handling mail and shipments, and coordinating printing and documentation
* Ensure compliance with operational policies and procedures, educating staff on best practices for expense management, travel bookings, and meeting room usage in coordination with central teams
* Ad hoc support to all areas of the business and the wider Business Infrastructure & Operations team as needed


**What we are looking for**
**Required attributes:** 
* Operational experience including but not limited to areas of HR, finance, legal, and business administration, ideally within a fast-growing international consultancy or professional services business
* Team player with strong interpersonal skills, positive attitude and the ability to build effective relationships at all levels
* Excellent coordination, time management and organisational skills; excellent communication skills (articulate, confident and adaptable to different audiences); strong attention to detail
* A proactive self-starter, comfortable using their initiative and working autonomously, able to identify and resolve issues to support all areas of the business
* Evidence of having a passion for working with people and working beyond the confines of the job description
* Very good knowledge (C1 level) of both Swedish and English is essential
* Excellent knowledge of Microsoft office suite


**Desirable attributes:** 
* Advanced Excel knowledge
* Experience of working with an ERP system


**What we offer**
 Some of the benefits we include are:
 * Collective Bargaining Agreement
* Wellness benefits
* Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)


 For more information about our benefits offerings in our Stockholm office, please reach out to us for additional information.
   

  

 At AER, we are committed to offering flexibility in the way we work. Most of our roles are hybrid with a mix of in-office/home working and potentially adjustable working hours. Let’s discuss what works for you and AER during the interview process.
   

  

 The Company is committed to the principle that no employee or job applicant shall receive unfavourable treatment on grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy, and maternity.
   

  

 To apply, please submit your Résumé / CV, a personal summary, your salary expectations and please inform us of your notice period.

title: Project Leader - Healthcare
description:
**Locations** 
 : Stockholm | Copenhagen V
   

  

 Who We Are
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
   

  

 To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
   

  

**Practice Area**
 "
 *Inspiring the bold who advance the health of care.* 
 " BCG’s global Health Care team works across the health care ecosystem to deliver sustainable competitive advantage for our clients, to create value for society, and to improve outcomes for patients. And we are passionate about it. We are committed to developing new insights and, through our customized approach, helping organizations navigate rapid change in today’s digital world. Our global health care team serves top companies across the health care industry - including biopharmaceuticals, medical technologies and devices, health care providers, payers, services, and global health. BCG’s Health Care Practice is the third largest industry practice globally, and second in the US.
   

  

 What You'll Do
