title: Senior Fullstack Java Developer
description:
Vill du ta din expertis inom fullstackutveckling till nästa nivå? Vi söker en senior utvecklare med lång erfarenhet av Java och moderna frontend-ramverk som vill vara med och bygga framtidens digitala lösningar tillsammans med oss på Accelerate.
   

  

**Varför Accelerate?**
 Vi erbjuder mer än bara ett uppdrag, vi erbjuder en plattform för att växa som expert inom modern mjukvaruutveckling! Hos oss får du inte bara arbeta med spännande teknik och kunder, utan du blir även en del av ett värderingsdrivet, passionerat team där du får stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och inflytande.
   

  

**Som Konsult Hos Oss Får Du**
* En skräddarsydd utvecklings- och certifieringsplan
* Utmanande och varierande kunduppdrag med den senaste tekniken
* Flexibilitet, frihet och balans mellan jobb och fritid
* En trygg och säker anställning med bra förmåner och kollektivavtal
* Ett sammansvetsat team av vassa specialister som lyfter varandra


 Vi tror på gemenskap och kompetensutbyte – här utvecklas vi tillsammans och stöttar varandra för att alltid ligga i teknisk framkant.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som senior fullstackutvecklare inom Java hos oss är du en nyckelspelare i att utveckla stabila, moderna och skalbara applikationer. Du bidrar med både teknisk erfarenhet och ett agilt mindset i projekt som gör skillnad.
   

  

 Du arbetar både med backendlogik i Java och Spring Boot, och med moderna frontendramverk som React och Angular. Du jobbar nära DevOps och är bekväm med CI/CD, containerisering och molnmiljöer.
   

  

**Exempel på vad du kommer att göra i ditt konsultuppdrag:**
* Utveckla och underhålla mikrotjänstbaserade backendlösningar i Java/Spring Boot
* Skapa intuitiva och responsiva användargränssnitt med React, Angular eller liknande.
* Arbeta med databaser som MySQL och Oracle DB
* Bygga och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines för automatisk testning och leverans
* Arbeta med Docker och Kubernetes för containerhantering och orkestrering
* Delta i arkitektur- och designbeslut samt mentorera juniora kollegor


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har minst 8 års erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare, med djup kompetens inom Java och erfarenhet av moderna webbteknologier. Du är lösningsorienterad, gillar att jobba nära verksamheten och har ett öga för både teknik och användarvärde. Du har en akademisk utbildning med inriktning mot systemutveckling, webbutveckling eller liknande.
   

  

 Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift. För denna position krävs svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat
   

  

**Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av några av följande:**
* Java, Spring Boot
* TypeScript/JavaScript
* React, Angular eller liknande
* MySQL, Oracle DB
* CI/CD-verktyg
* Docker och Kubernetes


**Extra Plus Om Du Har**
* Erfarenhet av molnlösningar (t.ex. Azure, AWS eller GCP)
* Erfarenhet av testautomatisering och TDD
* Certifieringar inom Java eller molnplattformar
* Erfarenhet av systemarkitektur eller teknisk ledarroll


**Placeringsort**
 Accelerate finns på flertal orter i Sverige och Norge. För denna tjänst utgår du från vårt kontor i Stockholm, med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
   

  

**Vi intervjuar löpande – vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!**
 Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig. Välkommen till Accelerate!**

title: Design and Test Engineer at Voltra
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Ventures and New Business at Scania have a key role in contributing to this vision. We drive the industry transformation: At Ventures and New Business we develop complementing solutions to our core and build new growth through ventures and investments. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

 Role Summary
   

  

 We are looking for an engaged and skilled
 **Hardware Design Engineer** 
 who wants to work with mechanical design, electrical components and testing. You will work with both low- and high-voltage systems as well as cable management and sheet metal development.
   

  

 In this role, you will combine
 **hands-on technical work with planning and coordination** 
 , giving you a unique opportunity to influence quality and performance in our solutions. You will be part of a collaborative team alongside hardware designers, software engineers, and power electronics specialists.
   

  

 Familiarity with Scania’s product development process is considered a merit.
   

  

 We are seeking someone with experience in testing and mechanical design who enjoys working cross-functionally within R&D. The role also requires strategic thinking and the ability to create clarity and momentum in a dynamic environment.
   

  

 Job Responsibilities
   

  

  

* Design and develop sheet metal components with integrated electronic systems together with our lead engineer
* Plan and execute tests according to project timelines
* Develop prototypes and support testing and validation activities
* Communicate effectively with suppliers and external partners to ensure technical quality
* Ensure compliance with standards and Scania’s PD process
* Collaborate with software and power electronics engineers to deliver integrated system solutions


 Who You Are
   

  

 You have several years of experience in product development and a broad technical perspective gained from working across different R&D domains. You are
 **proactive, solution-oriented, and thrive in an environment where innovation and collaboration are key** 
 .
   

  

 We believe you:
   

  

  

* Hold a relevant university degree in mechanical engineering, mechatronics, or similar
* Have a structured and proactive approach to planning and execution
* Bring hands-on experience with testing, prototyping, and validation
* Communicate clearly and build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders
* Enjoy contributing to strategic discussions and long-term product development
* Have experience working cross-functionally with purchasing, production, and sales & marketing
* Have worked in early-stage or entrepreneurial settings, preferably within charging infrastructure


 This Is Us
   

  

 Everyone working at Scania is united by a common purpose: Driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. We know that the transport industry must change, and it’s a change we want to lead. At Ventures and New business, we develop complementing solutions to our core and build new growth through ventures and investments that can accelerate us in driving the shift.
   

  

 People are core to our business. By joining our journey towards a sustainable transport system, you are contributing to the future of transport. You are part of a team that can create real change. At Ventures and New Business, we want to engage and inspire our full organization to create results together with us. Collaboration and entrepreneurial spirit is part of our culture and what makes us successful.
   

  

 By joining us you will be a part of driving meaningful growth in new ways!
   

  

 Scania Offers
   

  

 We offer you the chance to be part of an organization that is focused on reaching Scania’s targets and to truly drive the industry transformation. People who work here have the motivation and desire to constantly make things better.
   

  

 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options. Our office is located in central Stockholm at Drottninggatan and at Tomteboda. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-12-18. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 linda.rosenqvist@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer
description:
The Personalization team at Spotify makes deciding what to play next effortless and enjoyable for every listener. We aim to deeply understand music, podcasts, audiobooks, and videos to deliver exceptional recommendations that keep hundreds of millions of people engaged every day. Our work spans across experiences like Home, Search, curated playlists such as Discover Weekly and Daylist, and new innovations like AI DJ and AI Playlists.
   

  

 Search is one of the most important entry points into Spotify’s ecosystem—powering how listeners find and rediscover music, podcasts, and audiobooks. Beyond retrieval, Search drives exploration and discovery, connecting fans with creators in new ways. Building world-class Search means tackling natural language understanding, personalization, and generative AI at massive scale. Generative AI is also revolutionizing Spotify’s product capabilities and technical infrastructure, with generative recommender systems, agent frameworks, and LLMs opening significant opportunities to meet diverse user needs, expand use cases, and gain richer insights into our content and users
   

  

 As a Staff Machine Learning Engineer in Search, you’ll focus on recommender systems modeling at the intersection of generative recommenders and foundational understanding of user taste across music and talk content. You will define and execute the ML technical strategy for Search, building the next generation of Spotify’s recommendation systems, user representations, and supporting technical architecture. Join us and you’ll help millions of users discover and connect with the world’s audio content every day.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Define and drive the ML technical strategy for Search, focusing on retrieval, ranking, and generative approaches
* Build models that improve query understanding, personalization, and relevance across Spotify’s Search experiences
* Collaborate with a cross-functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering
* Prototype and productionize new modeling approaches at scale, serving hundreds of millions of users worldwide
* Lead high-impact projects from ideation through deployment, setting best practices for ML development, testing, evaluation, and experimentation
* Partner with tech leaders and stakeholders to influence priorities and ensure long-term scalability and impact
* Stay engaged with the broader ML and Search research community, applying emerging trends to Spotify’s challenges


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong background in machine learning and recommender systems, bridging research and user impact
* You have hands-on experience training and operating transformer models in production, or strong interest in doing so
* You have production experience developing large-scale ML systems in Java, Scala, Python, or similar languages. Experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow is a strong plus
* You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and leading high-impact projects from start to finish
* You’re a systems thinker and strong communicator who can align and influence technical and product stakeholders
* You care deeply about agile processes, data-driven development, and reliability
* You’re eager to apply emerging ML trends, particularly in LLMs and generative recommenders, to Spotify’s challenges


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the European region as long as we have a work location.
* This team operates within the GMT/CET time zone for collaboration.
* Excluding France due to on-call restrictions.


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.
   

  

 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Cloud SW Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for cloud software development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Cloud Software Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit in Stockholm, Sweden or Krakow, Poland
   

  

 Here, you’ll thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What would you do as a** 
**Cloud Software Developer**
 You would develop web applications for configuring and operating our wireless locks and systems. Your primary focus would be on cloud front-end development, while also contributing to back-end functionality.
   

  

 You would be part of a cross-functional, agile software team that includes mobile and cloud developers, QA specialists, and a UX designer. Collaboration with our firmware team would be essential to understand device functionality and communication. Additionally, you would work closely with product management to support and enhance the cloud software application.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, creating specifications, and breaking down implementation work into epics and user stories.
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Participate in end-user testing activities.
* Continuously explore, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience in software development, including a minimum of 2 years working with Angular.
* Hands-on experience with backend development, preferably in Go (Golang), and familiarity with RESTful APIs and cloud service integrations.
* Knowledge of test automation tools such as Jest, Playwright, or Cypress, and experience with CI/CD practices using Git.
* A background in Agile Scrum development and strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
* A technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field; a Bachelor's degree or higher is preferred.


 Ideally, you would have experience with several of the following: AWS development (e.g., Lambda, S3, CloudFront), headless CMS—preferably Sanity, AI tools like Cursor and Copilot for code development, and Agile methodologies such as SAFe.
   

  

 You’re a proactive and open-minded individual who takes initiative and enjoys learning. As a natural problem solver, you focus on solutions rather than obstacles. You thrive in cross-functional teams, value collaboration, and are always ready to support others while also seeking help when needed. You share our belief in lean and agile principles and enjoy working in an environment where diverse expertise comes together to drive successful outcomes.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* A benefits package.
* A dynamic and inclusive work environment.
* The chance to make a meaningful impact in attracting and retaining top talent.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Embeddedutvecklare C++
description:
*Drivs du av att se dina idéer bli verklighet? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva värld.*
**Din roll**
 Som ingenjör inom mjukvara hos oss får du en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av inbyggda system där programmering står i centrum. Du kommer att ta stort ansvar för din kod – från design och implementation till testning i våra testmiljöer/riggar..
   

  

 Du blir en viktig del i vårt agila scrumteam, som utvecklar avancerad mjukvara för kunder inom flyg-, marina och landbaserade applikationer. Våra produkter består av passiva sensorer som mäter radarsignaler för att skapa en tydlig lägesbild av omgivande plattformar – en central teknik för framtidens säkerhets- och övervakningslösningar.
   

  

 Sektionen är idag placerad på vårt kontor i Järfälla men kommer under 2026 förflyttas till vårt nya kontor i Solna strand.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är en lösningsorienterad person som är självgående och har ett stort intresse för teknik. Du trivs med att arbeta i en modern miljö där du får ta initiativ och påverka, både kopplat till teknik och arbetssätt. Du har även:
   

  

* Civil- eller högskoleingenjörsexamen inom Data, Elektroteknik, Teknisk Fysik eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av programmering och utveckling av inbyggda system.
* Minst några års erfarenhet av C++ programmering.


 Vi anser det meriterande med:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av radar- och sensorsystem.


*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
**Vad du blir en del av**
 Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här

title: Senior React Native Engineer
description:
**About 0TO9** 




**Team Is All** 




 Ideas matter – but people make them real. In finance, that’s harder than it should be. Innovation shapes how we live, but progress is slowed by complexity, regulations, and outdated systems. Too often, great people go elsewhere.
 



**0TO9 exists to change that.** 




 We’re a fintech venture builder and investor – a bank for entrepreneurship, founded in Stockholm in 2025 by serial entrepreneur Oliver Hildebrandt.
 



 Our mission: bring the right people, skills, and resources together so fintech founders can focus on building. From capital and compliance to tech and talent, we create an infrastructure for success.
 



 Numbers are the building blocks of finance and with zero to nine, we can build anything. Our name says it all: From you to a team. From idea to impact. From now to what’s next.
 



 With offices in Stockholm and Berlin, operations across the Nordics, and a growing portfolio – we’re just getting started.
 



  





**About the role** 




 You’ll be employed by 0TO9 and be lead engineer for our mobile apps, starting with building the app for our fintech venture Plus1 (of which we’ve already started building) – and over time supporting other products in the portfolio. You own the mobile app end-to-end: from first version to ongoing improvements, working closely with product, design and backend. You will:
 


* Build and maintain our React Native app for iOS and Android
* Design the architecture, tooling and standards for mobile at 0TO9
* Integrate with backend APIs and third-party services (auth, payments, analytics, etc.)
* Set up solid testing, release and monitoring practices for the app



  





**About you** 




 You’re a senior, hands-on mobile engineer who likes ownership and building things from scratch. You’re comfortable being the first mobile hire and setting the direction. You likely have:
 


* Several years of experience with React Native
* A track record of shipping apps to App Store and/or Google Play
* Strong skills in app architecture, state management and API integrations
* Experience with testing, performance and monitoring for mobile apps
* Professional English and a collaborative way of working
* Based in Stockholm or Wroclaw



  





**What we offer:** 



* Be part of the leading fintech venture builder
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial, international and fast-paced environment
* Strong opportunities for growth and development
* Leading role in building world-class mobile apps
